noun.definition: A permit from an authority to own or use something, do a particular thing, or carry on a trade.
noun.example: He was disqualified from driving and his license was endorsed.

noun.definition: Freedom to behave as one wishes, especially in a way that results in excessive or unacceptable behavior.
noun.example: The government was criticized for giving the army too much license.

verb.definition: Grant a license to (someone or something) to permit the use of something or to allow an activity to take place.
verb.example: A pub has to be licensed by the local council.

verb.definition: Authorize the use, performance, or release of (something).
verb.example: The company licensed the software to other firms.

usage_examples: You need a license to fish in this river.
They licensed the technology to a foreign company.
